item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=-Nothing link=topic=544749.msg4003683#msg4003683 date=1338364389]I dont see point in having LS on a PKing server(Or any server nowadays).

For a PK server fair enough but it’s not fair to say any server. We have programmed RSCD to be capable of expanding if we see more players online than we expect. It may never get to that stage but it’s a good idea to plan ahead just in case; doing that will reduce the downtime in the future. Put it like this, there’s stuff you could have done to have made your server more stable in the long run. You could have removed the LS before releasing (if that’s what’s causing problems) to prevent what’s happening now.[/quote]
The reason I said ‘or any server nowadays’ is because the rsc community doesn’t have enough players to get to that point when you need 2 worlds.

And I didn’t intend this to be a serious server, but taking that I’ve been developing it 8 hours a day and doing radical changes to the server. I’d say i’m starting to get pretty serious about this.

Read full topic

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

-Nothing:

No matter what a VPS costs, it should stay up unless it’s my fault that it goes down. And luckily, they got the VPS back up with all files there. But you’re right that I should take backups every 5 hours or so, and from now on I will. I don’t trust staminus at all, after hearing that this has happened to keith several times. Not to mention that all the other VPS’s I’ve had have never gone down.

I agree but Staminus is new to VPS’ and it’s the lowest of concerns as in business terms it generates the least revenue. It should be sorted regardless but ultimately it’s a 19$ VPS, if you’re not happy just go to someone else. My webclient hosting keeps getting cancelled so I’ve purchased like 10 different hosts to mirror across, some of them suck and it isn’t worth my time trying to get refunded so I just leave it rotting.

-Nothing:

I dont see point in having LS on a PKing server(Or any server nowadays).

For a PK server fair enough but it’s not fair to say any server. We have programmed RSCD to be capable of expanding if we see more players online than we expect. It may never get to that stage but it’s a good idea to plan ahead just in case; doing that will reduce the downtime in the future. Put it like this, there’s stuff you could have done to have made your server more stable in the long run. You could have removed the LS before releasing (if that’s what’s causing problems) to prevent what’s happening now.

Read full topic

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:61, topic:442102”][quote author=Iyashi link=topic=544749.msg4002830#msg4002830 date=1338250444]
I love this server, please do everything to get it back up. I will patiently wait, and I don’t mind losing everything because I know it wasn’t YOUR fault.

I will support you guys until the VERY end !!

~ Yuffie
[/quote]
It’s his fault for not backing anything up that he put onto a new 19$ VPS…[/quote]
No matter what a VPS costs, it should stay up unless it’s my fault that it goes down. And luckily, they got the VPS back up with all files there. But you’re right that I should take backups every 5 hours or so, and from now on I will. I don’t trust staminus at all, after hearing that this has happened to keith several times. Not to mention that all the other VPS’s I’ve had have never gone down.

The server is going to be down for another 1-2 days, I’m working on few upgrades along with LS removal that should make the server more stable. Because if I put it up now, you would get rollbacked every 10 minutes or so, because of the new networking the GS disconnects from LS randomly.

I dont see point in having LS on a PKing server(Or any server nowadays). So I’m removing it and making threaded login processing/loading on gameserver.

If anyone is interested on what changes I have made during the 2 days of downtime:
Replaced MINA with Netty
Threaded packethandling
Removed LoginServer
Removed packet queueing(Saw no real use for it, just slowing things down)
Removed RSCD’s npchandling, objecthandling and replaced it with our new system which allows us to update the npc’s and objects at any time.
A minor thing; I removed all the content that has to do with skilling.
Changed our client to basic 202 client
DBPool
Added threaded loginprocessing/loading.

After these changes latency dropped radically, from 500ms to 200ms while playing from my PC on server hosted at staminus; And on localhost, the latency is around 20ms. (Server->Client->Server latency)

After I get it done I will open the server for testing purposes. If everything runs without any problems, I will put it up again.

EDIT: The VPS is now down again… sigh -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @ISwearImNotKeith ISwearImNotKeith
item.description:
@ISwearImNotKeith wrote:

-Nothing:

Obviously. It’s still not up and no response from the customer support.

They have been messing a lot of things up with it recently, they probably had a HD failure and didn’t have any backups and are in a “Oshit” moment because they can’t back anyones files up.

I haven’t gotten a response to my ticket for about 15 hours so far, I also went on Live chat not long ago, and the person left on me lol.

I said,

"I was wondering what was going on with my Server lately, it has been down for about 24 Hours now and I haven't gotten a response to my Support Ticker for about 15 hours"

I then also added saying it was down probably for about a total of 80 hours this first month because of things on their end and all she said was,

" I am so sorry. Maybe you can email billing@staminus.net for a credit."

Then I replied and never got a response then 5 minutes later a closed session.

edit:
Also, don’t get your hopes up on them recovering things for you. They just told me everything of mine was unrecoverable. But I had backups anyways.

Read full topic

So much for that Staminus VPS. lol… its offline… all freakin day.
[/quote]
Something happened to our VPS, this isn’t our fault at all, it’s on staminus side. rsc-reloaded seems to be having the same problem as us. For some reason they just can’t bother to fix it, instead they will re-install the OS to get it easily ‘fixed’. Which means, there might be reset coming up soon…

Yo tears, if you read this, next time dont use your personal ip for ddosing.

More like don’t use your real ip to log in if you have a botnet and used it to DDoS the server you’re playing, and admitting it…

IIRC RSC-reloaded has had problems with staminus a lot; usually the same thing happens all over again, and that is that the vps just goes down without any reason at all… Weird that luke’s server stays up and the 2 competing servers go down…[/quote]Maybe they’re VPS service just sucks…
